title: Job agent arrested for defrauding youth over Rs. 900,000 by promising employment in Romania
byline: A manager of a Sri Lankan foreign employment agency has been arrested on suspicion of defrauding an individual of Rs. 945,000 by falsely promising him a job in Romania.

title: Pharmacists at Kurunegala Hospital to token strike today
byline: The Society of Government Pharmacist has announced that a 24-hour token strike will be staged today (13) at the Kurunegala Teaching Hospital.

title: Wife of South Korea’s jailed ex-president arrested
byline: South Korea’s former first lady has been arrested over a string of charges including stock manipulation and bribery.

title: Madonna urges Pope to visit Gaza ‘before it’s too late’
byline: Madonna has urged Pope Leo XIV to visit Gaza and bring his “light to the children before it’s too late”.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall above 50 mm likely in some areas today
byline:
Showers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in Galle and
Matara districts.

title: Human-Elephant Conflict: Officials mull relocating elephants that encroach on villages
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Defence, Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd) chaired a meeting at the Defence Ministry, to review the ongoing measures to mitigate the escalating human-elephant conflict.

title: Tamil Nadu fishermen strike in Rameswaram over frequent Sri Lanka Navy arrests
byline: Rameswaram fishermen in Tamil Nadu have commenced an indefinite strike condemning frequent arrests by Sri Lanka Navy, according to India media reports.

title: Maduru Oya Helicopter Crash: Pilot claims he lost control of helicopter within 30 seconds of taking off
byline: The Bell 212 helicopter, piloted by Flight Lieutenant Paulen Jayawardena, lost control and crashed into the Maduru Oya Reservoir within 30 seconds of taking off from the Maduru Oya Army Special Forces Camp during a demonstration flight, the pilot testified before the Dehiattakandiya Magistrate’s Court.

title: AI camera systems to be installed in SLTB and private buses to reduce accidents
byline: A total of 40 AI camera systems will be installed in both Sri Lanka Transport Board and private buses as part of a new project launched with the aim of minimizing accidents involving long-distance buses.

title: Rajinikanth’s Coolie sets record; First Tamil film to top $2M US pre-sales
byline: Lokesh Kanagaraj’s highly anticipated multi-starrer Coolie, led by superstar Rajinikanth, is set for its grand release.

title: Pharmacists at Kurunegala Hospital on token strike today
byline: The Society of Government Pharmacists has announced that a 24-hour token strike will be staged today (13) at the Kurunegala Teaching Hospital.

title: Floods affect over 1.7 million people in India’s Bihar
byline: Over 1.7 million people were affected by the ongoing flooding in India’s eastern state of Bihar, officials said Tuesday.

title: Southern Taiwan shuts down ahead of arrival of Typhoon Podul
byline: A large swathe of southern and eastern Taiwan shut down on Wednesday and hundreds of flights were cancelled ahead of the arrival later in the day of Typhoon Podul, with thousands of people evacuated.

title: Public can directly WhatsApp IGP to report crimes from today
byline: Sri Lanka Police has introduced a new WhatsApp number for the general public to directly inform the office of the Inspector General of Police (IGP) pertaining to crimes and various other issues they encounter.

title: Govt keen to increase export earnings to US$ 36 billion by 2030
byline: Another round of discussions has been held to review and address challenges in achieving the government’s target of increasing export earnings to US$ 36 billion by 2030.

title: No reports of enforced disappearances in Sri Lanka in 2024: US State Department
byline: The United States says there were no reports of enforced disappearances in Sri Lanka by or on behalf of government authorities in 2024.

title: Man hacked to death in Seeduwa
byline: An individual has been hacked to death in Seeduwa.

title: Sri Lanka’s remittance inflow exceeds US$ 4 billion in 2025
byline: Sri Lanka has received US$ 697.3 million in workers’ remittances in July 2025, according to the latest figures released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Kerala cannabis valued over Rs. 24 mln seized in Pesalai
byline: A total of 110 kilograms and 600 grams of Kerala cannabis have been seized in Pesalai, Talaimannar by the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: Special discussion to be held tomorrow aimed at uniting the entire opposition
byline: A special discussion is scheduled to be held tomorrow (14) with the participation of several opposition political parties.

title: Apple iPhone 17 series launch date tipped for September 9
byline: The anticipated launch of the iPhone 17 series is set for September 9.

title: Woman flees after defrauding job seekers promising employment in Japan
byline: A number of complaints have been lodged against a woman from Mount Lavinia, who had defrauded people of money by claiming she could find employment in Japan.

title: Former Deputy Director of Prison Hospital Dr. Hemantha Ranasinghe arrested
byline: Former Deputy Director of the Prison Hospital, Dr. Hemantha Ranasinghe, has been arrested on bribery charges.

title: Priyantha Weerasooriya appointed as Sri Lanka’s 37th IGP
byline: Priyantha Weerasooriya has been appointed as the 37th Inspector General of Police of Sri Lanka.

title: Suspects in murder of former Homagama PS member to be produced in court
byline: The suspects arrested in connection with the murder of a former member of the Homagama Pradeshiya Sabha, which occurred in Meegoda yesterday, are scheduled to be produced before the Kaduwela Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Shooting incident reported in Minuwangoda
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in Pathaduwana, Minuwangoda, at around noon today (13), police stated.

title: Former Deputy Director of Prison Hospital remanded
byline: Former Deputy Director of the Prison Hospital, Dr. Hemantha Ranasinghe who was arrested on bribery charges earlier today (13), has been remanded until August 19.

title: Five Chinese cybercrime suspects detained at BIA and deported
byline: Five Chinese nationals suspected of attempting to enter Sri Lanka to engage in cybercrime activities have been arrested today (13) by officers of the Immigration and Emigration Department at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake.

title: Electric vehicle sales growth eases to 21% in July, research firm says
byline: Global electric vehicle sales grew 21% year-on-year in July, the slowest rate since January and down from 25% in June, as momentum in plug-in hybrid sales in China slackened, market research firm Rho Motion said on Wednesday.

title: Zelenskiy heads to Berlin for online meeting with Trump, European leaders
byline: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy travelled to Berlin on Wednesday for a German-hosted virtual meeting with Donald Trump and European leaders, two days before the U.S. president meets Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska.
